website_summaries.verdict: Speedy, highly accurate readings make this middle-of-the-road model worth considering.
pros: Earns praise for offering a high degree of accuracy as well as being easy to calibrate
cons: A few customers had longevity concerns, as some units malfunctioned for no apparent reason

customer_reviews.title: Accurate and Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Just put in the batteries that come with it and it is ready to use. I checked it against the pulse oximeter in doctors office and it is 100% accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Numbers easy to read, quick response
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Gives quick readings. I am asthmatic and my Dr. recommended me getting one. A reading of 94% and up are good for me. Just a note, make sure your fingers are room temperature. Cold fingers don't provide an accurate result. And keep finger steady, no movement. Always read directions. Also comes with a case and lanyard.
customer_reviews.author: Red

customer_reviews.title: Helpful to have.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this oximeter to give us a little peace of mind during this pandemic and as a guide to help us during this time of uncertainty. It was recommended to us by someone in the health field. It is very easy to use and easy to read.
customer_reviews.author: PW

customer_reviews.title: Calibrates with doctor's
customer_reviews.text: This is a very accurate oximeter and calibrates with my own doctor's
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: APPEARS TO BE ACCURATE
customer_reviews.text: THIS OXIMETER READ 95% ON MY FINGER AND IT COINCIDES WITH THE READINGS I GET ON THE ONE AT WORK IN THE HOSPITAL. I UNDERSTAND IT'S DESCRIPTION IS "NOT FOR MEDICAL" PURPOSES BUT IT APPEARS TO BE AN ACCURATE DEVICE WHEN COMPARED TO A REGULATED ONE. I THINK IT WAS A BIT PRICEY, THEREFORE I KNOCKED OFF A STAR ON THE RATING.
customer_reviews.author: Susie706

customer_reviews.title: Arrived ahead of time
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for a friend that was just diagnosed with COVID 19. When she asked me to find one oximeter and saw how long it will take, I was afraid that it would arrived too late but it came 3 days after and worked well (I tried it before giving it to be sure)
customer_reviews.author: Me&onlyme

customer_reviews.title: That it works!!
customer_reviews.text: I am a cover 19 patient. I have cover pneumonia. my respiratory doctor said that I should keep track of my oxygen levels and heart rate. This oximeter is the same type as used by doctors and nurses and I think this one is faster than all the others I have seen. I love it!!
customer_reviews.author: bennie warrington

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Product
customer_reviews.text: It's my first ever fingertip pulse oximeter and I'm very happy with the device as It's very easy to use for people with little or zero experience. All you need to do is to slide in your finger in the hinge, turn on the device and wait for couple of seconds and the results will be displayed on screen...........So simple. Design, Shape & colors of the device are also very attractive......Definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: PK

customer_reviews.title: Great oximeter for my mom!
customer_reviews.text: My mom needed a blood oxygen so I purchased this for her. I chose something for her for a long time and I chose this one and I was not mistaken. It is very compact and fits in her bag. She is happy and I am glad. I recommend to everyone!
customer_reviews.author: Geoff Walburn

customer_reviews.title: Great product/ reliable brand
customer_reviews.text: This product is good quality, accurate readings and average price. I like the case it comes in and it arrived quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Simpson

customer_reviews.title: Feedback
customer_reviews.text: Thank you. Very good product easy to use and read. Would gladly do business with again.
customer_reviews.author: Nate D

customer_reviews.title: Pass this brand up.  Only works half the time.
customer_reviews.text: This Oximeter stop working properly after only a few uses. Sometime it will work, and sometimes it doesn’t, sometimes it gives an accurate reading, sometimes it doesn’t. I bought this as a 2nd Oximeter to carry with me. I should have stuck with a trusted brand. My INNOVO brand is still going strong after having & using it for months. But this brand here, although it looks a lot like my INNOVO, is going in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Sassy and OliverTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Very necessary for old people
customer_reviews.text: I used to buy it for my grandmother and she, as an elder, needed it very much. It is very good that there are batteries included. Very compact and lightweight. The device is very good, the readings are bright, large and easy to read.
customer_reviews.author: Greg MacKellan

customer_reviews.title: This is a scam.
customer_reviews.text: First thing I noticed is that the end of the box had been torn. Obviously had been sold before and returned. Second thing I noticed it that it did not work. At all. It gave no readings.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Kyte

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I can't speak to it's oxygen accuracy since I have nothing to compare it to but it seems to be. When I take deep breaths the reading will go up. Pulse is accurate or very close to my pulse when I measure it on my blood pressure machine. Easy to use. Works well and automatically shuts off.
customer_reviews.author: Jersey Girl

customer_reviews.title: Powerful medical technology that's saving lives.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the best for in-home monitoring. Currently, I've been very sick with the CoV-2 SARS virus, and I lack health insurance and access to emergency care. The ER doctor said to purchase a pulse oxygen monitor for peace of mind, and to monitor my O2 levels for long-term problems. I'm so grateful for such a cheap and easily accessible medical grade technology. I can now have peace of mind, and an updated measurement for doctors when I need to be admitted.
customer_reviews.author: Payton Smith

customer_reviews.title: Ridiculously Irreproducible
customer_reviews.text: I am a healthy invidivdual with normal oxygen saturation and pulse rate. I tested this device several dozen times over 48 hours and found it horribly irreproducible for the oxygen saturation. (Pulse rate was reproducible and accurate.) It reported my saturation to vary between 98% and 35%, and there were a number of those low readings. Hmmm, if 35% had been correct, I wouldn't be writing this because I'd be dead.
customer_reviews.author: Red

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Received this handy device yesterday, pretty quick delivery, and immediately put it to use. The carrying case is awesome as well as the lanyard, easy to use and has very easy to read display. With all the concerns around Covid this device along with a contact less thermometer is a must to keep in the house. Great value.
customer_reviews.author: Doc Ozone

customer_reviews.title: Good price, good oxygen reader
customer_reviews.text: I usually don't write reviews, but because I look for reviews before buying any product, I decided to write a review on this item. Great thing to keep track of oxygen levels for the whole family. Easy to use and very compact. He fits in my bag and I can go to work with him. I really recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Andrews

customer_reviews.title: Appears to Work Well
customer_reviews.text: The product appeared to work and do what its supposed to do. At rest I get readings of 95-100 and a pulse of 50 -65 (my pulse really is that low at times). After lifting weights briefly and breathing hard, the pulse is above 100 and the O2 drops into the 80s before returning to 95 plus. My only reservation is that I have no way to check it against a known good machine. But from what I can see it works and works well.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Test it out before throwing it out
customer_reviews.text: At first it would give me inconsistent readings (I’m pretty healthy and was getting sats in the 70s/60s) but after a few days of testing I learned that I have to wait until the double lines show up after turning it on and then sticking my finger in. Your finger has to be well placed to the top. For people with long nails, this may create an interference. Anyways, so far it gives me accurate readings after I made these adjustments.
customer_reviews.author: Nance

customer_reviews.title: Generally reliable
customer_reviews.text: I was able to compare this oximeter to an expensive medical grade one, and the readings were identical. I was impressed. The next day, I found that this oximeter was giving me abnormally low readings, not confirmed by the medical grade one. Accuracy improved with a recheck. So this is a useful device, usually accurate. If the reading doesn’t seem right, or the device is beeping, then try again. Possibly a finger placement issue?
customer_reviews.author: Isabel

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't work every time and the readings are incorrect.
customer_reviews.author: Nina Antonova

customer_reviews.title: Peace of mind during Covid-19. Just in case.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this oximeter because this brand was recommended. Product price is a little high but it was delivered quickly. It works great and has a travel pouch. I bought because of Covid-19 but will also take it with me to Breckenridge, CO where I get altitude sickness.
customer_reviews.author: rose

customer_reviews.title: Valuable information
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a Pulse Oximeter ever since COVID-19 and discovering that using a Pulse Oximeter is a good indication is one had symptoms of the virus Order was received very quickly within a day. Device is easy to use with large LCD display. It’s also very accurate. My other half is a nurse and she was also impressed with it. I purchased it based on the reviews and cost and I am definitely not disappointed. Nice handy case with a strap to wear it around your neck.
customer_reviews.author: NJ AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: plethysmograph Is unreliable.
customer_reviews.text: Pros Easy to read numbers Nice on-off button Rapid readings Cons Pulse bar chart (plethysmograph) is unreliable and unusable. Pulse is calculated too frequently and bounces around Device is a bit thick compared to some My last O2 monitor would accurately pick up PVCs and other irregularities, but this one does not. The bar chart stays at 1 bar, unless I place my hand in hot water for 30 seconds before use - which is a hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Sorry not a great product
customer_reviews.text: Not what I thought it should be. The reading are very conflicting. One second you read it and it Reads very low the next second after your worried it reads normal. This product as made very cheaply. But I guess you get what you pay for. It was very inexpensive. Coming out of the package you can just tell. But what a great case it comes with. So unfortunate. Really .
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: Does not work!
customer_reviews.text: Following the directions exactly, this oximeter worked ONCE only on multiple tries. It is flimsy and the only time it DID show oxygen saturation, the number changed constantly, with wide variation. Clearly inaccurate. A complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Growth through Learning

customer_reviews.title: This little thing works just like the one at the doctor's office!
customer_reviews.text: With telemedicine appointments becoming the rule rather than the exception, having the ability to provide a full set of vitals to the doctor gives them the information they need to make decisions about medications etc. This little gizmo works just like the one at the doctor's office. I have no way to measure accuracy, but neither does the doctor's office. I wish the instructions had been just a little bit more clear in terms of how to put the batteries in but other than that I have no complaints. Great little device!
customer_reviews.author: TrishS

customer_reviews.title: A great monitoring device to have
customer_reviews.text: After using this continuously over last couple months I have to say that it has be a very great device to have!! We purchased this for my mother that has been having issues with low oxygen levels due to going though chemotherapy and some other medical issues. It's come in very handy for her because she is able to keep an eye on how everything is going, share the information with her doctor and they can adjust things as needed. It is definitely a very well made product and the accuracy matches that of the ones the doctors use while she is in their office. Highly recommend due to the product's high quality and our experience with it so far!!
customer_reviews.author: MiseriesChild

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend it.  Works great.
customer_reviews.text: That the readings are big enough to read. Lights up great. It came quickly, and great for the price. My husband has COPD, and he was asked to get it, by his Dr, to use everyday for his breathing. It has helped him to check his breathing. Would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Tomlin

customer_reviews.title: Not satisfied
customer_reviews.text: This does not work all the time. Takes several tries to get the readings. Not satisfied at all with this purchase. Waste of time and money.
customer_reviews.author: carol daugherty

customer_reviews.title: Good for home use.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great meter, easy to use and read. It gives a result quickly and hr monitor is spot on with other devices I have. The carrying case is a nice addition. Gave accuracy 4 out of 5, because while I've used it and feel confident in the results I cannot guarantee calibration. I did notice some minor difference in o2 level from a professional unit I have access to, but again I'm not able to measure calibration and the variance is/could be considered within normal from test to test. Overall, this is a great unit and as a person with breathing issues I feel confident that I can get reliable information with this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use - Simply clip on a finger and push a button to see O2 and heartrate!
customer_reviews.text: Simply clip on a finger, push the On/Off button and readings are displayed until you take it off. The readings appear to be accurate and consistent. The red LED display is clear and displays well for someone to monitor another person in light or dark conditions. (Using this device yourself the display winds up being backwards in this regard.) Installing the batteries can be a bit tricky - Look in the manual for instructions and note they are installed with both pointing in the same direction (which is not typical). The oximeter comes with a storage case and lanyard so you can have it with you.
customer_reviews.author: WojoTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: It shows oxygen levels and heart rate
customer_reviews.text: It does what is says. In the box it brings everything shown in the picture and the batteries. It has one power bottom to turn on/off the device. I bought this to use for breathwork retention. Once I started using it, it started beeping once the oxygen levels are >95%. I couldn't figure out a way to change the range or turn it off by reading the manual. The accuracy decreases as the oxygen levels decrease as well.
customer_reviews.author: Susy Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Arrived quickly; easy to use
customer_reviews.text: On April 21, I ordered a pulse oximeter from an Amazon marketplace vendor whose name implied that it was the manufacturer. That device never arrived (I'm still working to get my money back). When I looked for pulse oximeters again recently, I found this one (available through Amazon Prime) in stock. It arrived in two days and appears to work fine. It's very easy to use; just install the batteries (included), push one button, put in on a finger and read out oxygen level (98% in my case) and heart rate.
customer_reviews.author: David C Christian

customer_reviews.title: Quick and with a large display
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice little gadget for any doc, nurse, or medic. It’s small and fits in a pocket and is nice to have during rounds so I don’t have to go looking for a pulse ox if a patient isn’t hooked up. Seems to work well and appears to be pretty accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Scott G

customer_reviews.title: Extremely accurate
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed at the accuracy of this pulse meter. I've tried several others and they either didn't work or didn't give an accurate measurement. I'm definitely pleased with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Luna Edison

customer_reviews.title: Handy, for peace of mind.
customer_reviews.text: I assume the user knows what to look for with this critical instrument. It's hard to rate 'accuracy' but the key idea is to look for sudden change in readings. Fairly repeatable - within 1 to 3 points. Funny.. despite stated fears of public health professionals a few months ago, I am not tempted to walk around with it on my finger. Use it once3 or twice a day.
customer_reviews.author: Jim A

customer_reviews.title: Good O2-pulse monitor, especially during this pandemic
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these in my wish list and when the pandemic hit, they were no where to be found, or the prices were jacked up. They finally updated the inventory so I decided to give this model a try. Packaging was good. I provides a nice nylon case for storage and a lanyard which I will never use. My caution with this unit, and I'm sure they all are the same in this manner, is to ensure your finger tip is securely touching the IR sensor when placing in the unit. Otherwise, the reading could be off and cause concern. Over all a good medical tool to have on hand. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: R BTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Piece of mind...
customer_reviews.text: We purchased the fingertip pulse oximeter due to the covid19 virus. We would rate it a 5 out of 5. It's FANTASTIC! The price was great, much less than I expected. My husband and I both are "at risk" for the covid19 virus and having this to check our blood oxygenation while wearing masks or if needed for "vitals" for a telehealth appt., it gives us a sense of security in knowing how we're doing. And yes, so far, so good! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: S. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Everything you need in one little package, including the batteries.
customer_reviews.text: I would recommend this Fingertip Oximeter to my family and friends. I like that this purchase included: Batteries, Lanyard and Case. Everything you need without any additional purchases. This item is sleek looking and has only one button, making this easy to use. This is very comfortable and portable. I also like the large and clear readings. It seems to be very accurate and reads the same as my Fitbit for the pulse. Highly recommend! - Debra Techlin
customer_reviews.author: Debra Techlin

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I received the Fingertip Pulse Oximeter very quickly, and I was impressed with how easy it was to use. Just put in the provided batteries, and that was it! I tested it on several different fingers, on myself and my wife, and it seemed to give accurate and consistent results. No muss, no fuss. I am glad that I bought an extra one to send to my sons, so they will also have an easy and accurate way to check their blood oxygen levels during the Covid crisis. I also appreciate the padded storage bag. A very professional product!
customer_reviews.author: Rabh Marrach

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor, easy to use and accurate!!
customer_reviews.text: As an asthmatic I know how important it is to monitor your oxygen level. This unit works great. I tested it out to see if I was having a drop in my oxygen after wearing a face mask. Sure enough after 15 minutes of wearing a mask my level dropped 2 points. At least it confirmed what I was feeling. Anyway it’s a great tool to keep on hand and this one is easy to use and accurate!
customer_reviews.author: Cristina Carreno

customer_reviews.title: good value
customer_reviews.text: This fingertip oximeter is super helpful and convenient. It's very accurate unlike others I have tried, and I love how I can fit it in my purse easily
customer_reviews.author: Parker Remy

customer_reviews.title: Can be finicky
customer_reviews.text: Installed the batteries provided in the box and the unit turned on, however, it didn't read my pulse, etc, the first sever times I tried. I let the unit power off (takes about 10 seconds) and then tried again and it worked. This happens almost every time I try to use it. It seems if you insert your finger prior to turning the unit on, it works better. When it does work, it seems to be correct, though I have no current comparison with a medical-grade unit.
customer_reviews.author: SLD

customer_reviews.title: I Probably Don't Have COVID
customer_reviews.text: When my family members tested positive for COVID-19, a friend in the medical community suggested purchasing a pulse oximeter like this one to test our blood oxygen. I recommended this one to one of my family members who purchased it and used it to monitor their oxygen levels. Shortly afterwards I ordered one for myself. It is compact, easy to use, and the pulse rate is accurate–leading me to believe that the oxygen saturation is as well. At this point, everyone in my household (and extended family) have great oxygen levels, and so now we send one another pictures to compete to see who has the best pulse rate + oxygen saturation.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Mulder

customer_reviews.title: Jumper Pulse Oximeter
customer_reviews.text: I want to thank you for your on time delivery of your Jumper JPD-500E Pulse Oximeter. I was diagnosed with ground glass in my lungs during a hospital stay in January and I’m very concerned and want to keep track of my oxygen levels. It will ease my mind to be able to check my O2 sats at home until I have my next CT scan.
customer_reviews.author: Marie Antoinette

customer_reviews.title: Important item to have for the age of telemedicine and COVID
customer_reviews.text: For regular doctor's appointments, the nurse would always check my blood pressure, weight, pulse and oxygenation. With the pandemic and so many appts going online, I figured it would be good to have this on hand to provide the information to the doctor since I already have a scale and blood pressure monitor. And especially since COVID affects the lungs/oxygenation, this item is good to have in case one of us comes down with it and needs to monitor how they're doing.
customer_reviews.author: Leigh Watson

customer_reviews.title: Fast and accurate!
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this pulse ox and so far it’s my favorite! I am a nurse and I use a pulse ox every day to spot check my patients. I have tried several different brands. This one is the best by far! It’s fast, accurate, easy to read and I love that it beeps when it is not getting good contact! I am going to buy an extra one just to keep on hand because I love this one so much! Thanks for such a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Donna Rob

customer_reviews.title: New standards equipment for every home
customer_reviews.text: The pulse oximeter is now a necessary addition to every household. I waited two weeks and paid double but what choice did I have? Thinking about choices afterwards, I was able to order two more on eBay, paid half the price, received them within a week and they are equally accurate. Nonetheless, I am satisfied with my Jumper Pulse Oximeter.
customer_reviews.author: JustPeace

customer_reviews.title: These are great for peace of mind in this Covid 19 age
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure I'm not the only one who wants to stay away from the doctor's office, so any of these over the counter devices that can help me do that, especially at this price, are well worth it. It quickly and easily gives you readings for your blood oxygen levels and pulse rate. Less than one minute, and it gives you an alert "beep" if your numbers are below a healthy range. Also, this model comes with its own little pouch to store it in.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable and Would Not Recommend
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 1 for me & 1 for a friend. My Pulse Oximeter is unreliable. It works occasionally and gives very different readings. For example, I used it 4 consecutive times this morning. It did not work twice. One reading said my oxygen level was 88. I repeated it right away. I got a reading of 98. It constantly beeps which is annoying. I would not recommend this Oximeter. Get another brand, but not this one.
customer_reviews.author: MF

customer_reviews.title: Received What I Hoped For
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this product to track my oxygen levels during this trying time of COVID-19; my fitness tracker does not do this. This produce and reviews helped me decide that the purchase outweighed the cost of a new fitness tracker. After several days of use I experience the consistency of measurement and ease of use. At times I do not correctly place my finger in the reader - another feature is the sound it makes if a reading is out of line (I have low blood pressure and pulse rates so occasionally it dips below the norm.
customer_reviews.author: Gettysburg Resident

customer_reviews.title: Lemon.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is all over the place. Even after putting in brand new batteries, within one minute I got readings from 90-97, it would go up and up and up and then back down. An alarm goes off when it gets to 94 and its loud. My doctor said to toss it. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Frequent buyer

customer_reviews.title: Good Price For Very Good Product
customer_reviews.text: After using a friend's Walgreen's oximeter, I decided to purchase the same one. However, due to high demand, the oximeter was replaced with another brand, which did not feel sturdy and the readout was small and was horizontally placed. After reading many reviews and checking pricing, I came upon this fingertip pulse oximeter and, if one can love an inanimate object, ...I love it! It is sturdy and very easy to read. I love that the readout is vertical.
customer_reviews.author: Polly Periwinkle

customer_reviews.title: Helped save my life
customer_reviews.text: I got the coronavirus, unfortunately. I had to go to the ER on several occasions. They told me to buy this kind of product to monitor my oxygen level. In all honesty I believe it saved my life, along with the doctors and nurses of course. I measured it and it showed a 90./. They said to go to the ER if it dropped below 93. I went, the reading was accurate and they admitted me to the hospital. My husband also got the virus and of course this meter was very helpful in monitoring his oxygen level as well. I am extremely satisfied with it and highly recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: In this particular time of my life, I wanted to be prepared were any of my friends, family or myself were to get sick. I bought this and tried it and it worked fabulously, then I tucked it back into my cabinet so it’s there when I need it. It’s a really nice design and works exactly as I hoped. I don’t know much about oxygen in the blood, but it does tell you what it should be in the package which I appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: AmyVonne

customer_reviews.title: Good Value for the Money
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this unit based on the reviews I saw on Amazon. The item came very quickly. The packaging was compact and not wasteful. The carrying case was nice though I likely won’t use the lanyard. Once I inserted the batteries, I found the unit very easy to use. While the unit is small, I could easily read the results on the device. I did not realize that the unit was sensitive to movement (difficult to get a reading). Once I figured that out, I had no problems getting results within a short time of putting it on my finger. Would definitely recommend this item as the price point was good relative to other comparable products.
customer_reviews.author: BizzyMom

customer_reviews.title: Just right!
customer_reviews.text: After reading lots of comments for many different pulse oximeters, I finally settled on this one from Oximeter Superstore (Gurin Products). It is all I wanted it to be—easy to use, seems to give consistent readouts, and doesn't vary all over the place as some people complained about other meters. Over the last several days the two of us have used it to establish base numbers so we'll recognize if we have health concerns in the future. The best part: the price was right and it arrived quickly. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Always prepared

customer_reviews.title: Handy device
customer_reviews.text: Good to keep on hand especially during Covid. Quick, easy way to check pulse and blood oxygen levels just like at the doctors office. Now when so many doctor visits are by telemedicine it's good to have on hand. Price was reasonable also.
customer_reviews.author: gadget nut

customer_reviews.title: Product does not work
customer_reviews.text: I tried to use this product 10 times. I used different fingers. I held hand very still. I tried laying my hand on the table. Of the 10 times, it only gave a reading once. Upon starting it, it attempts to take a reading, and then just shuts off completely. I thought maybe the batteries were no good and put new ones in. This did not help either. While fighting covid19, I borrowed a relatives pulse ox that was made by the same company, but is no longer in production. It worked flawlessly every time. I figured they made good products but made a mistake in choosing this pulse ox.
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: I'm a home health nurse and I love it!
customer_reviews.text: This is seriously one of the best o2 sat monitors I've ever used. It's the little things. The battery panel LOCKS into place (no more lost battery covers!) The top and bottom of the monitor flushly interlock (harder to accidentally pull and break.) The screen doesn't rotate with each button press (for some this is a "pro", others it's a "con", but I'm personally in favor of it.)
customer_reviews.author: David G.

customer_reviews.title: Easy and fast way to check your blood oxygen level
customer_reviews.text: This product is substantial and works very well. I was skeptical when my wife ordered it, but it is a quality product. I've read that doctors are discouraging folks from getting them, but if you want to be safe, or have any doubts, this device can give you reassurance.
customer_reviews.author: jfb

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Our family has been using this oximeter, particularly during the pandemic, to check our oxygen levels. It’s very easy to use. Just insert your index finger palm down and preferably on a flat surface. It takes approximately 4-5 seconds to get the readout. The results display quickly and are clear and precise. It comes nicely packaged with an included carry case, lanyard and batteries.
customer_reviews.author: DeePrinz

customer_reviews.title: Monitor For A Loved One
customer_reviews.text: We love this this monitor, it's easy for my sister to monitor the oxygen level for my mom who is in the end stages of cancer and also at risk for Covin-19. The physician requires we monitor mom's oxygen level as a way to determine when we need to call the ambulance, the monitor has given us another tool to help us care for our mom.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time. Finger position on pad is important. There are times I have to position my finger a couple times before I get a acceptable reading. I took it the other morning just before seeing my nurse practitioner. My oxygen level was a 98 at home. it was a 95 when I was with the nurse practitioner. I don't know if I got a defective one or they're all giving inaccurate results.
customer_reviews.author: teacher

customer_reviews.title: Seems glitchy
customer_reviews.text: About 80% of the time it reads correctly. But the other 20% it reads way too low. I’m not sure why. I know it is low because I have two of these and the other one always reads my oxygen between 95-99. This reads those levels most of the time, but sometimes it will just read between 30-80. That’s just too low to believe it is correctly reading. Want to return this.
customer_reviews.author: ER Nurse

customer_reviews.title: Great Pulse-Ox
customer_reviews.text: I researched this product "9 best Pulse-Ox article" prior to purchasing. Once received, I was pleasantly surprised at how compact and easy to use. I use it multiple time a day, since COVID-19. I wanted to establish a baseline so that I would have a idea of what normal is for me. Readings are very consistent and matches with my providers' reading. Your product was better than expected!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate
customer_reviews.text: This is not accurate. We have tried it on four healthy individuals and the oxygen saturation ranges from 99% (likely correct) to the 80's. The pulse rate is more accurate, but runs low. We have checked that on other devices. Pros: easy to read. Alarm goes off if the pulse is too low or oxygen saturation is low. Cons: since it is inaccurate, the alarm goes off constantly.
customer_reviews.author: wegotit

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use but didn’t last.
customer_reviews.text: This oximeter was easy to use if your finger nails are trimmed short , else get errors. The battery compartment cover latch is poorly designed and fragile, broken in the first month of use , but too late for Prime return. Amazon also over-charged for this item at the start of Covidd-19 pandemic, and marketed it as a top seller. Despite being an Amazon Prime customer , elderly with chronic underlying condition in higher risk, i paid $59.95 Amazon Prime in March 2020 for the same item that today Amazon sells for $17.95, and could not return it for refund after it broke. Jim V
customer_reviews.author: Jim V

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: I received the meter from Amazon and have been using it since. During these days of Covid-19 I find it very useful to keep a close eye on my aging father and the rest of my household. From what I have read a oximeter is a good and early indication of lung problems and saves unnecessary trips to the doctors office. The quality of the device is excellent and I like the hand strap that is included. This little meter had become very useful to me since I got it last week. I would recommend this meter to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Bob P.

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: This product is excellent and it works great. So far, the product has accurate readings and very reliable. I've recommended this product to family members and they love it was well.
customer_reviews.author: Michael hunter

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, in all aspects of use/convenience
customer_reviews.text: I am a physician, and ordered one, through AmazonPrime, for personal and professional use. I am so impressed by its accuracy (I validated it against a hospital oximetry/anesthesia monitor on a different finger). Furthermore it is lightweight, convenient, easy-to-read, and reasonably-priced, and it updates quickly to reflect real-time changes in oxygenation levels. I may well buy some more for my medical practice - to have one in each exam room. I will greatly appreciate your sending me a complimentary 4-port-USB-fast-phone charger. My mailing address is 10696 Mira Lago Terrace San Diego, CA. 92131 With warmest professional regards, stay well David Plourd ("Dr. Dave") And Please remember: Be Kind to the ocean, her creatures, and each other
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This product does what I need it to do.
customer_reviews.text: I'm hoping not to need this, but in light of what's going on with COVID-19, I wanted it on hand in case anyone in my household becomes ill and develops breathing problems. It was easy to use out of the box and is easy to read, so now it is stored away for safekeeping and future use. The good news is it arrived much faster than I'd originally anticipated - less than 2 weeks!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa R

customer_reviews.title: Jumper Oximeter Excellent Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the Jumper fingertip pulse oximeter on May 8. I was extremely pleased to receive it by May 15. This set up was very easy. It is very easy to use. I was happy to find out that an alarm goes off when the oxygen saturation levels are too low. My husband was recently diagnosed with COVID-19. As a result, his oxygen saturation has suffered. As he hopefully improves, having a reliable tool to track his progress gives a sense of comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Hat

customer_reviews.title: Quick reading, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: We ordered your Pulse Oximeter for our son to take with him as he moves into his dorm at college. We are worried about the spread of COVID, and one of the recommendations was to check oxygen level on a regular basis. We received it in just a couple of days. The oximeter works great, and I liked that it had a carrying case to keep it protected when he throws it in a drawer. It gives a quick reading and I think that will encourage him to use it often.
customer_reviews.author: Shel Phel

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I did not want to go to the doctor, but it appears to be accurate. It is easy to use. The instruction pamphlet is in extremely tiny print. The company kindly sent me a digital version. I would recommend this item, but be warned. It may tell you something you did not want to know; that you do have a serious medical problem.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Fremont

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use & Easy to Read!
customer_reviews.text: I was provided a rebate for my review of this pulse oximeter. I honestly love this pulse oximeter. It is both easy to use and easy to read. It is fast and accurate. I really appreciate that the numbers are faced for individual use. It makes it easy for patients to see their numbers and for me to educate them while taking their vitals. The numbers are large enough for my patients with bad eyes. Not one of my patients complained about the amount of pressure on their fingers. If you are in need of a pulse oximeter, I would definitely get this one. I will buy this one in the future when I have a need.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey LaBarge

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate 02 cheap plastic built
customer_reviews.text: Not accurate.these pictures say "jumper" on description mine does not. Cheap Plastic not well built. Not the same as in pictures o2 readings are way off... Not accurate at all. Going to send back
customer_reviews.author: cottontail

customer_reviews.title: Pulse Oximeter Model-JPD-500E works very well
customer_reviews.text: Just received the Pulse Oximeter Model-JPD-500E today. First off I see that it was manufactured in Apr 2020, so it is great to see that I am getting a new device. A quick look at the Instruction Sheet enclosed revealed this is a very easy device to use. After putting the batteries in, I took my readings. The results were very fast and the display is easy to read. I highly recommend this to anyone that needs to monitor blood oxygen levels.
customer_reviews.author: charles tait

customer_reviews.title: Good to Have Around the house
customer_reviews.text: This product is wonderful to have around tge housel, love the pocket pouch it comes with. My only complaint would be the batter's that came with the product. The product keeps saying the battery is low, however they're brand new. So sometimes the product does not operate. I Have yet to try a new battery.
customer_reviews.author: Salina Lesesne

customer_reviews.title: Accurate, Easy to use and Worth your money! 😊
customer_reviews.text: Hello! I just received the Pulse Oximeter I ordered from Amazon. I tried it right away and it’s pretty accurate! I even tried it on my dad’s and he said it’s accurate for him too. It is also easy to use as you don’t really need to read the manual guide! It’s really great. I can use this for our family and at work because I work at a Nursing Home Facility and some of our vital signs equipments are not working so I decided to get one of my own and just bring it with me. So thankful! Worth the money! 😊😊
customer_reviews.author: Ellie

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't work for COPD
customer_reviews.text: This device had factory set normal of 95-100% oxygen. I have COPD and my normal is 89-90. The unit would alarm whenever I attempted to check my level. Additionally, it would only check it once, then had to be turned off and restarted to check again. There was no way to turn the alarm off or reset it at my level. It was noted in the instructions the device was for sport or FAA use not medical, too bad that info wasn't provided prior to purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas R. Braun

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product - great value!
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding pulse oximeter! This well-made device provides rapid pulse and oxygen saturation results that are very accurate -- comparable to results I received in my doctor's office. Easy to use and attractive design with clear display. Exceptionally good pricing for a perfect device to have at home during COVID-19 crisis. Thank you very much!
customer_reviews.author: Donald A. Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Everyone needs this oximeter
customer_reviews.text: Best an oximeter that I had. I once had another pacemaker, but it didn't suit me functionally. I also want to thank the seller, fast delivery and batteries included. I recommend everyone to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Evelyn Baired

customer_reviews.title: This is super easy to use!!
customer_reviews.text: Just got my pulse oximeter yesterday an I love the ease of use for it. I am a health aide at an elementary school, so will definitely use it when we finally go back. I love being able to check the pulse ox and heartbeat of my family members since I was told that the amount of oxygen in your blood can be another indication of you being sick. Having it brings me a little extra piece of mind.
customer_reviews.author: T. Reinhardt

customer_reviews.title: With Covid-19 out there, I need to know our blood oxygen levels.
customer_reviews.text: My husband has a slightly lower blood oxygen level because of medications that he takes. I wanted to track that and his pulse rate as he begins anew exercise program. I also want to track blood oxygen levels for us during this Covid-19 situation. If our blood oxygen levels go down, even if we are not having other symptoms, I will contact our doctor. Your odometer makes me feel confident that I have accurate information.
customer_reviews.author: Linda R

customer_reviews.title: Peace if mind
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son to take to college in case he comes down with Covid and needs to isolate. Quarantine/isolation are in single dorm rooms with some but not constant monitoring. This gives me some peace of mind that if sick he can monitor his oxygen levels and be able to call someone if needed rather than wait for someone to check on him.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Legut

customer_reviews.title: A must-have in the time of Covid
customer_reviews.text: I have always wanted one of these just out of curiousity, but I went ahead and bought one to have on hand in case anyone in our family gets Covid because it seems like people's oxygen levels in their blood can dip dangerously low with Covid without them recognizing the severity of the situation. I'm glad to have one on hand - and I'll be glad even when Covid isn't as much of a concern.
customer_reviews.author: sara by the season

customer_reviews.title: Form meets function, does the job.
customer_reviews.text: like the form factor, it feels solid enough to be satisfying. The readout is bright and easy to read, while providing results that seem to be within range for a home use device - these sort of measurement products are intended to be used for general assessment of your overall condition, and this oximeter adequately does that job. Overall, I’d give this 4 stars so far.
customer_reviews.author: Lehmann Family

customer_reviews.title: Great small medical item
customer_reviews.text: It was recommended to have a pulse oximeter to be able to read all vitals at home. This item had a lot of great reviews and we're glad we purchased it. It shipped fast. It works well. Easy to operate - just put it on and push 1 button. Nice large readout. Comes with a nice case to store it in. Would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Donald E Longenecker

customer_reviews.title: The best oximeter I've ever seen or used!
customer_reviews.text: This is the coolest pulse oximeter I've ever seen or used! I ordered it for myself and I really like it. It is easier to use than others. It fits in my pocket and it's very comfortable. I like the sturdiness and compact style. Batteries were included which was a plus but no need to wait to use it. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Kirsten Pawloski

customer_reviews.title: Gave Me Peace of Mind
customer_reviews.text: I love this! I was experiencing COVID-19 symptoms and the shortness of breath and chest pressure prompted me to buy this. It arrived the next day and I immediately put it to use. My friend who works in healthcare told me what oxygen level is considered low and when to seek medical attention, so I monitored myself regularly. Best $25 bucks I spend as it gave me absolute peace of mind the entire time I wasn't feeling well (10 days). I'm happy to have it on hand in case anyone in mind family falls sick as well.
customer_reviews.author: C. Estrada

customer_reviews.title: Arrived quickly and works well
customer_reviews.text: We are happily using our pair of Fingertip Pulse Oximeters that were received on Thursday June 11, 2020. This product arrived very quickly which was very satisfying. It works well for tracking our blood oxygen and pulse on a regular basis very easily. Thank you for a great product at a very reasonable price. It's important to our peace of mind to be able to verify our blood oxygen is staying normal since the virus can cause blood oxygen to drop and, in some causes, folks have not even noticed the downward trend.
customer_reviews.author: M. Mallory

customer_reviews.title: Not Accurate
customer_reviews.text: We were using a borrowed one (different manufacturer) for about 4 months and it gave us a correct reading first time, every time. This one takes from 2 to 4 times of putting your finger in to get a correct reading. The pulse may show correct but the SpO2 level will show 83% or something else extremely low and the alarm will go off. It takes like I said 2, 3, 4 times to get a correct reading of both at the same time. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Kneelk

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money and beware of return deadline!
customer_reviews.text: I kept thinking I was the reason this thing didn't work like the ones in doctor's offices and hospitals. Kept playing with it to make sure. Even replaced the batteries. Still slow (longer than a 1 minute or more), dots showing it work only got to 1 dot, and sometimes it just didn't register at all! Missed return deadline by one day. If I had known there was a dead line I would have returned it immediately! Not happy at all!
customer_reviews.author: Pmp

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Device !!
customer_reviews.text: There were many of these oxygen sensor meters to choose from and I am glad I decided to purchase this one. Delivery was very quick. Very well constructed and easy to use. Gives reading of oxygen level and heart rate within a few seconds. Good value for the money. Comes with handy carrying case for protection. Highly recommend buying this item from this seller !!
customer_reviews.author: Ronnie

customer_reviews.title: Great accuracy for a great price
customer_reviews.text: At my age I'm told I should monitor nearly everything, and oxygen absorption is one of the more important functions to keep an eye on. With the range of prices, I feared that I might be getting a less accurate or less dependable one, but I was pleasantly surprised. It works every time with perfect accuracy--and it didn't cost much.
customer_reviews.author: Timeout

customer_reviews.title: Not in the least bit accurate
customer_reviews.text: While this is easy to use, you just put it on. The numbers are is to read. But it is completely inaccurate. I took it to my doctor and I would get an oxygen reading as low as 57. My doctor told me 70 to 80 I would be in bed. There are plenty others to choose from, not worth the few dollars you save buying this one.
customer_reviews.author: cyberwar
